info.name: Oracle Fusion Cloud FIN - External Cash Transactions
info.description:
REST API collection for Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials â€” External Cash Transactions module.

Created by [Adrian Anderson](https://www.linkedin.com/in/aanderson1017/) | [YouTube - Better Human Applications](https://www.youtube.com/@BetterHumanApplications)

item.name: External Cash Transactions
Delete an attachment for an external transaction

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

variable.description: (Required) The unique identifier of the external transaction.

(Required) This is the hash key of the attributes which make up the composite key for the Attachments resource and used to uniquely identify an instance of Attachments. The client should not generate the hash key value. Instead, the client should query on the Attachments collection resource in order to navigate to a specific instance of Attachments to get the hash key.

response.name: No Content. This task does not return elements in the response body.

variable.description: (Required) The unique identifier of the external transaction.

(Required) This is the hash key of the attributes which make up the composite key for the Attachments resource and used to uniquely identify an instance of Attachments. The client should not generate the hash key value. Instead, the client should query on the Attachments collection resource in order to navigate to a specific instance of Attachments to get the hash key.

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical

item.name: Create an attachment for an external transaction

header.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, the server performs an Upsert operation instead of a Create operation. During an Upsert operation, the server attempts to find an existing resource that matches the payload. If a match is found, the server updates the existing resource instead of creating a new one. If not found or false (default), the server performs a Create operation. Note that the Upsert operation isn't supported for date-effective REST resources.
The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

variable.description: (Required) The unique identifier of the external transaction.

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:

This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AttachedDocumentId; integer; The unique identifier of the attached document.
  • CategoryName; string; The category of the attachment.
  • CreatedBy; string; The user who created the record.
  • CreatedByUserName; string; The user who created the record.
  • CreationDate; string; The date and time when the record was created.
  • DatatypeCode; string; The type of the attachment.
  • DmDocumentId; string; The unique identifier of the attachment.
  • DmFolderPath; string; The folder path of the attachment.
  • DmVersionNumber; string; The version number of the attachment.
  • ExpirationDate; string; The expiration date of the contents in the attachment.
  • FileName; string; The file name of the attachment.
  • LastUpdateDate; string; The date when the record was last updated.
  • LastUpdatedBy; string; The user who last updated the record.
  • LastUpdatedByUserName; string; The user who last updated the record.
  • Uri; string; The URI of the attachment.
  • Url; string; The URL of the attachment.
  • UserName; string; The user who created the attachment.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • PrimaryKey: Finds an attachment associated with an external transaction based on the unique attached document identifier.
    Finder Variables:
    • AttachedDocumentId; integer; The unique identifier of the attachment.

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

variable.description: (Required) The unique identifier of the external transaction.

header.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, the server performs an Upsert operation instead of a Create operation. During an Upsert operation, the server attempts to find an existing resource that matches the payload. If a match is found, the server updates the existing resource instead of creating a new one. If not found or false (default), the server performs a Create operation. Note that the Upsert operation isn't supported for date-effective REST resources.

The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AccntServicerReference; string; The reference number assigned by the account servicing institution for the underlying payment, receipt, external transaction, or payroll payment.
  • AccountingFlag; boolean; The option that indicates whether the accounting event is raised when the external transaction is reconciled.
  • AddendaTxt; string; Additional information about the entry details.
  • Amount; number; The transaction amount of the external transaction.
  • AssetAccountCombination; string; The cash general ledger account code combination of the external transaction.
  • BankAccountName; string; The name of the bank account associated to the external transaction.
  • BankConversionRate; number; The accounting conversion rate used to convert the external transaction amount from the bank account currency to the ledger currency.
  • BankConversionRateType; string; The accounting conversion rate type used to convert the external transaction amount from the bank account currency to the ledger currency.
  • BankTransactionId; string; Unique identifier of the bank transaction on the statement line.
  • BusinessUnitName; string; The name of the business unit associated to the external transaction.
  • CheckNumber; string; The check number of the underlying transaction.
  • ClearedDate; string; The date when the external transaction is cleared.
  • ClearingSystemReference; string; The unique identifier assigned by the clearing system to a payment instruction.
  • CreatedBy; string; The user who created the external transaction.
  • CreationDate; string; The date and time when the external transaction was created.
  • CurrencyCode; string; The currency code of the external transaction.
  • CustomerReference; string; The customer reference used by BAI format.
  • Description; string; The description of the external transaction.
  • EndToEndId; string; The unique identification assigned by the initiating party to the transaction. It's passed on unchanged throughout the entire end to end chain.
  • ExternalTransactionId; integer; The unique identifier of the external transaction.
  • InstructionIdentification; string; The unique identification which is a point to point reference used between the instructing party and the instructed party to refer to an individual instruction. It's assigned by the instructing party to the instructed party and can be included in several messages related to the instruction.
  • LastUpdateDate; string; The date and time when the external transaction was last updated.
  • LastUpdateLogin; string; The session login associated with the user who last updated the external transaction.
  • LastUpdatedBy; string; The user who last updated the external transaction.
  • LegalEntityName; string; The name of the legal entity associated to the external transaction.
  • OffsetAccountCombination; string; The offset general ledger account code combination of the external transaction.
  • ReconReference; string; The reference to the underlying transaction information.
  • ReferenceText; string; The reconciliation reference of the external transaction.
  • Source; string; The source of the external transaction. The default value is Imported.
  • Status; string; The status of the external transaction. The default value is UNR for Unreconciled. Unreconciled external transactions can be rendered as void by updating this attribute to VOID.
  • StructuredPaymentReference; string; The structured payment reference or receipt reference on the bank statement line.
  • TransactionDate; string; The date when the external transaction is created.
  • TransactionId; integer; The sequence number transaction identifier of the external transaction.
  • TransactionType; string; The transaction type of the external transaction. Examples include Bank adjustment, Fee, Check, Electronic funds transfer, Interest, Zero balancing, Lockbox, Miscellaneous, and Automated clearing house. A list of accepted values is defined in the lookup type CE_TRX_TYPE.
  • TransferId; integer; The unique identifier of the bank account transfer or the ad hoc payment that created the external transaction.
  • ValueDate; string; The actual value date of the external transaction.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • ExternalCashTransactionsFinder: Finds external transactions based on a combination of different query parameters.
    Finder Variables:
    • bindBankAccountId; integer; The bank account identifier associated to the external transaction.
    • bindBankAccountName; string; The name of the bank account associated with the external transaction.
    • bindCurrencyCode; string; The currency code of the external transaction.
    • bindTransactionDate; string; The transaction date of the external transaction.
    • bindTransactionId; integer; The transaction identifier of the external transaction.
    • bindTransactionReference; string; The reconciliation reference of the external transaction.
    • bindTransactionSource; string; The source of the external transaction.
    • bindTransactionStatus; string; The status of the external transaction.
    • bindTransactionType; string; The transaction type of the external transaction.
  • PrimaryKey: Find the external transaction based on the primary key.
    Finder Variables:
    • ExternalTransactionId; integer; The unique identifier of the external transaction.
  • findByTransactionBankAccountId: Finds the external transaction that matches the specified bank account identifier.
    Finder Variables:
    • bindBankAccountId; integer; The bank account identifier associated to the external transaction.
  • findByTransactionCurrencyCode: Finds external transactions based on the specified currency code.
    Finder Variables:
    • bindCurrencyCode; string; The currency code of the external transaction.
  • findByTransactionDate: Finds external transactions based on the specified transaction date.
    Finder Variables:
    • bindTransactionDate; string; The transaction date of the external transaction.
  • findByTransactionId: Finds the external transaction based on the specified transaction identifier.
    Finder Variables:
    • bindTransactionId; integer; The transaction identifier of the external transaction.
  • findByTransactionReference: Finds external transactions based on the specified transaction reference.
    Finder Variables:
    • bindTransactionReference; string; The transaction reference of the external transaction.
  • findByTransactionSource: Finds external transactions based on the specified transaction source.
    Finder Variables:
    • bindTransactionSource; string; Transaction source of the external transaction.
  • findByTransactionStatus: Finds external transactions based on the specified transaction status.
    Finder Variables:
    • bindTransactionStatus; string; The status of the external transaction.
  • findByTransactionType: Finds external transactions based on the specified transaction type.
    Finder Variables:
    • bindTransactionType; string; Transaction type of the external transaction.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. Instead, the client should query on the collection resource with a filter to navigate to a specific resource item. For example: products?q=InventoryItemId=<value1>

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • ExternalTransactionId; integer; The unique external transaction identifier.
  • __FLEX_Context; string; The descriptive flexfield context name for external transactions.
  • __FLEX_Context_DisplayValue; string; The descriptive flexfield context display value for external transactions.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • PrimaryKey: Finds all descriptive flexfields associated with an external transaction based on primary key of the external transaction.
    Finder Variables:
    • ExternalTransactionId; integer; The unique identifier of the external transaction.

response.name: The following table describes the default response for this task.

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

variable.description: (Required) The unique identifier of the external transaction.

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2

item.description: The attachments resource manages documents that are attached by the user to the external transaction.
